subtitles.text: Well, it has begun, Upgod. This time we have Akari Uemura of Juice Juice and Nanami Kubota of Ochanoma.
This is a program that takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
We will show you the process of recording and rehearsal.
Let's start with the two MCs.
I, Uemura, think that now that we are able to speak out, we get a lot more calls at our live performances,
I myself, Uemura, have always been a person who does not sweat much on my face. During the past three years.
Oh, really?
But after I started to be able to speak out, I started to sweat so much that it was almost a lie,
Yume Kudo used to be a sweaty girl who splashed around a lot, so I was a little bothered by it,
But when I put myself in her shoes, I realized that this was how I felt, and it was a lot of fun.
It was really hot, partly because it was summer, and I could really feel the heat of the live performance in my body,
So I would like to continue to control my sweat so that it doesn't become a nuisance.
It is true that I have an image of you always staying clean without sweating.
I kind of thought so myself, but I guess I was wrong.
Are you saying that one day you will suddenly become one?
Yes, that's right.
Neither of us are the type to sweat.
I've recovered my sweating as well as my voice, so I'd like to adjust it.
Yes, I, Kubota, have recently started thinking one day that I want to have a beautiful back,
A back beauty.
I started to do some stretches before going to bed to make my back beautiful.
I started doing back stretches before going to bed.
I stretch my back for about five to seven minutes, and it seems to relieve my stiff shoulders,
I have been doing it for about a week now, and my shoulders have become a little softer.
It's great that my shoulders feel better just by having a cleaner shoulder line.
Then I think I'll start this summer too.

Yes, I watched the music video and thought it was very Angstrom-like, but when I saw the making of the music video, even the voices that are not used in the music video and the voices in the background are very Angstrom-like, with their sparkling smiles and sunny days. It's like they were wearing summery outfits.
I also saw that they made the props by themselves, so I felt that they made the music video by themselves, so I thought it was really wonderful.

Yes, I always thought that everyone in Angulum got along well with each other, but after seeing the behind-the-scenes of this music video shoot, I realized that everyone really had fun filming the music video.
I could feel that everyone really enjoyed shooting the music video, and I thought it was really wonderful.
It was so moving.
It was a very nice music video.

I've seen a lot of videos this time, but I was really moved by Angstrom's "Alumni" and I could feel the goodness inside Angstrom from this making-of video, and I thought it was really wonderful.
I was really impressed by the music video, but the making of the video made me realize the charm of Angstrom in a new way.
I was recording Hirai Miyo and Yobuno Reno's vocals, and I thought that recording really brings out each person's personality.
I thought it was really interesting that the tempo of the person directing the recording was the same, but the atmosphere was completely different.
UpCami takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the UpFront Group.
Please subscribe to our channel to get a glimpse of what you don't normally see.
This time upcami is with Akari Uemura of Juice-Juice and Nana Kubota of Ocha no Ma.
